. Hi Jeroen,
I'm not sure why you can't do a checkout. That is quite strange.
However, if you don't care about having all of the history, you can do:
git clone --depth 1 git://github.com/liferay/alloy-ui.git
You can change depth to being whatever you want it to be (the higher the entry, the more commit entries you'll get).
We have done aggressive garbage collection, but that actually won't fix anything, since garbage collection runs locally.
The problem/benefit with git is that the repo size is because of the history of everything that was ever committed.
This repo used to be on Subversion, and since we didn't have git modules, we stored YUI as a zip in the repo (with a build task to extract it properly).
But in addition to that, we also have other large binaries that have been committed at one time or another. These all exist in the history.
We're currently looking at ways to remedy this, but whichever path we take will require deleting some history, which will cause some problems for people who already have the repo cloned. Basically, we're trying to find a way to minimize those problems, and reduce the repo size down to a manageable level.
I hope that helps give some context :)
Thanks Jeroen

. Hey guys,
Regarding the https, it's not as simple as purchasing the certificate for alloyui.com. The reason is because the CDN is what serves the content, so the cert has to be stored and served by the CDN.
The cost for doing this is considerably more than $60 dollars a year. We're currently in the process of setting up a global domain for all Liferay properties to be able to access it, but it won't be the same domain.
It may be similar, but probably won't be able to just have a protocol-less url (which might be better... the protocol-less method doesn't work if you copy/paste it into a file that you're testing with running from your local file system).

About the combo handler, we've discussed having it on a node js instance before, but there's little value at this point. We'd have to create another server to just run node js for the combo handler, as well as write this combo handler (and debug any potential issues).
We already have one that runs in PHP, we've been using it for years and unless we can have some sort of quantifiable reason to change, it would simply be a distraction.
@jonathantneal about why it's not a "plugin" is that it needs to concatenate the files on the server-side to return all requested modules in one http request.
In Liferay, our combo handler is in Java, but Eduardo also wrote one in PHP to run from a host that only has PHP (which is far more common).
I believe people have written other ports for it in other languages, but not sure.
. We're getting SSL support for the CDN, but it just won't be under the same
domain. I'm not sure what it will be quite yet, but as soon as I know, I'll
update the ticket.

brunocoelho:
Do you guys use vim? Add these lines at your .vimrc and it will remove automatically trailing spaces when you save a file.
shell
" Strip trailing whitespace
function! <SID>StripTrailingWhitespaces()
  " Preparation: save last search, and cursor position.
  let _s=@/
  let l = line(".")
  let c = col(".")
  " Do the business:
  %s/\s\+$//e
  " Clean up: restore previous search history, and cursor position
  let @/=_s
  call cursor(l, c)
endfunction
autocmd BufWritePre * :call <SID>StripTrailingWhitespaces()
